body_content.explanation: a national park (= a large area of land protected by the government because of its natural beauty or because it has a special history) in the US Virgin Islands territory:
examples: The preserve also acquired 5,000 unspoiled acres on St. John Island that in 1976 became the Virgin Islands National Park.
Over 90 vessels either washed aground or sank in waters surrounding Virgin Islands National Park after Hurricanes Irma and Maria.
